definition.name: Create a Release
definition.description: Create a release for a tag in your repository
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: tag_name
inputs.description: The name of the tag. This should come from the webhook payload, `github.GITHUB_REF` when a user pushes a new tag

inputs.name: release_name
inputs.description: The name of the release. For example, `Release v1.0.1`

inputs.name: body
inputs.description: Text describing the contents of the tag.

inputs.name: body_path
inputs.description: Path to file with information about the tag.

inputs.name: draft
inputs.description: `true` to create a draft (unpublished) release, `false` to create a published one. Default: `false`

inputs.name: prerelease
inputs.description: `true` to identify the release as a prerelease. `false` to identify the release as a full release. Default: `false`

inputs.name: commitish
inputs.description: Any branch or commit SHA the Git tag is created from, unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: SHA of current commit

inputs.name: owner
inputs.description: Owner of the repository if it is not the current one

inputs.name: repo
inputs.description: Repository on which to release.  Used only if you want to create the release on another repo

outputs.name: id
outputs.description: The ID of the created Release

outputs.name: html_url
outputs.description: The URL users can navigate to in order to view the release

outputs.name: upload_url
outputs.description: The URL for uploading assets to the release
